title: Low Schema.org Coverage Hurting Discoverability
do: Implement Schema.org markup on all vehicle listing pages, city pages, and dealer profiles. Priority: Car, LocalBusiness, FAQPage, BreadcrumbList. Use Google's Rich Results Test to validate.
dont: Don't copy-paste generic schema without customizing for actual vehicle data. Avoid schema spam with irrelevant types.

title: Vehicle-Specific Schema Missing on Listings
do: Add Product/Car schema to every vehicle listing with complete attributes: price, mileage, fuelType, transmission, VIN. This unlocks Google's Vehicle Listings feed eligibility.
dont: Don't use generic Product schema without vehicle-specific properties. Avoid missing required fields like image_link or vehicle_mileage.

title: Slow Largest Contentful Paint Hurting Rankings
do: Optimize hero images with WebP/AVIF, implement lazy loading for below-fold content, preload critical fonts, and use CDN for static assets. Target LCP < 2.5s.
dont: Don't load all images eagerly. Avoid render-blocking JavaScript in <head>. Don't ignore Core Web Vitals - Google uses them for rankings.

title: Layout Shifts Degrading User Experience
do: Set explicit width/height for all images, reserve space for dynamic content (ads, lazy-loaded sections), use CSS aspect-ratio. Target CLS < 0.1.
dont: Don't inject content above existing content without reserved space. Avoid web fonts causing FOIT/FOUT without font-display: swap.

title: Slow Interaction Response Times
do: Debounce expensive operations, use web workers for heavy computation, code-split JavaScript bundles, implement virtual scrolling for long lists.
dont: Don't run expensive operations on the main thread. Avoid blocking the event loop with synchronous operations.

title: Invisible to AI Search Engines (ChatGPT, Perplexity)
do: Create AI-optimized content hubs answering "best used cars in [city]", publish Trust Layer methodology, build comprehensive vehicle buying guides, maintain fresh market insights.
dont: Don't rely on traditional SEO alone. Avoid thin content - AI engines prefer comprehensive, authoritative sources. Don't ignore E-E-A-T signals.

title: Thin Content on City Landing Pages
do: Expand city pages to 1200-1800 words with: local market insights, popular models by city, price trends, dealer recommendations, neighborhood guides, RTO data.
dont: Don't stuff keywords. Avoid generic content that could apply to any city. Don't duplicate content across city pages.

title: Limited Topic Authority Coverage
do: Build content clusters around: car buying guides, financing options, insurance tips, maintenance advice, resale value guides, city-specific insights, brand comparisons.
dont: Don't create shallow articles. Avoid orphan content - interlink all topic clusters. Don't ignore user search intent.

title: Weak Internal Linking Structure
do: Implement hub-and-spoke linking: city pages → brand pages → listings. Add contextual links in content, related listings carousels, breadcrumbs on all pages.
dont: Don't use generic "click here" anchor text. Avoid footer-only internal links. Don't create orphan pages with no internal links.

title: Low Entity Recognition by Search Engines
do: Use consistent entity mentions: brand names, city names, car models. Implement schema markup for entities. Create dedicated pages for high-value entities.
dont: Don't use vague references ("this car", "here"). Avoid inconsistent naming (Honda City vs Honda City Sedan). Don't ignore Wikipedia/Knowledge Graph entities.

title: Canonical URL Mismatches Confusing Search Engines
do: Audit and fix canonical tag mismatches. Ensure sitemap URLs match canonical URLs. Remove duplicate content variants from sitemap.
dont: Don't use relative canonical URLs. Avoid self-referential canonical chains. Don't submit non-canonical URLs to sitemap.

title: Limited Schema Type Diversity
do: Implement diverse schema types: FAQPage for common questions, BreadcrumbList for navigation, Review/AggregateRating for listings, HowTo for guides.
dont: Don't use only Organization schema site-wide. Avoid schema types that don't match page content.

title: Mobile Performance Gap vs Desktop
do: Optimize for mobile-first: reduce image sizes for mobile viewports, implement responsive images with srcset, minimize JavaScript for mobile, use service workers for caching.
dont: Don't serve desktop-sized images to mobile. Avoid large JavaScript bundles that block mobile rendering.

title: Missing FAQ Sections on Key Pages
do: Add FAQ sections to city pages, brand pages, listing pages with FAQPage schema. Answer: pricing questions, inspection details, paperwork process, financing options.
dont: Don't create generic FAQs. Avoid duplicate FAQ content across pages. Don't forget FAQPage schema markup.

title: Missing Breadcrumb Navigation
do: Implement breadcrumbs on all pages with BreadcrumbList schema. Structure: Home → City → Brand → Model → Listing.
dont: Don't use breadcrumbs without schema markup. Avoid breadcrumbs that don't match URL structure.

title: Unoptimized Images Slowing Page Load
do: Convert images to WebP/AVIF, implement responsive images with srcset, use image CDN with automatic optimization, lazy-load below-fold images.
dont: Don't serve original high-res images. Avoid loading all images on page load. Don't skip alt text (impacts accessibility + SEO).

title: Stale Content Losing Relevance
do: Publish weekly market updates, price trend reports, new listing highlights. Update city pages monthly with fresh statistics. Add publish/modified dates with schema.
dont: Don't let content go stale for months. Avoid outdated price information. Don't forget to update lastReviewed in schema.

title: Weak Local SEO Signals
do: Optimize for "used cars in [city]" queries. Include city-specific data: RTO codes, local dealer networks, regional price trends. Build city-specific backlinks.
dont: Don't use generic location pages. Avoid thin doorway pages for every city. Don't ignore local business schema.

title: Missing Trust Signals for AI Engines
do: Publish Trust Layer methodology, display verification badges, show AI compliance scores, link to authoritative sources (SIAM, RTO data), add author bios.
dont: Don't make unverifiable claims. Avoid hiding data sources. Don't ignore E-E-A-T (Experience, Expertise, Authoritativeness, Trust).

title: Structured Data Validation Errors
do: Audit schema with Google Rich Results Test and Schema.org validator. Fix missing required fields, invalid property types, orphan entities.
dont: Don't ignore validation warnings. Avoid nested schema without proper @id references. Don't use deprecated schema properties.

title: Poor Page Experience Metrics
do: Comprehensive Core Web Vitals optimization: LCP < 2.5s, CLS < 0.1, INP < 200ms. Use Chrome UX Report data for real-user monitoring.
dont: Don't optimize for lab scores only. Avoid ignoring mobile CWV. Don't delay fixes - Google uses CWV for rankings.

title: Flat Site Architecture Limiting Authority Flow
do: Build hierarchical architecture: Homepage → Hub pages (Cities, Brands) → Spoke pages (Listings). Use pillar-cluster model for content.
dont: Don't create flat structures with all pages at same level. Avoid orphan pages. Don't ignore authority flow via internal links.

title: Duplicate Content Diluting Rankings
do: Use canonical tags consistently, consolidate duplicate pages, implement 301 redirects for moved content, use parameter handling in Search Console.
dont: Don't create multiple URLs for same content. Avoid boilerplate content. Don't index filter/sort variations.

title: Missing Conversion-Focused Content
do: Add clear CTAs on every page, include contact forms prominently, showcase trust badges, add social proof (reviews, ratings), simplify listing inquiry process.
dont: Don't hide contact options. Avoid multi-step forms for simple inquiries. Don't ignore mobile conversion paths.

title: Accessibility Barriers Hurting Reach
do: Add alt text to all images, ensure keyboard navigation works, use semantic HTML, maintain color contrast ratios, add ARIA labels where needed.
dont: Don't use images for text. Avoid auto-playing media. Don't ignore screen reader testing. Accessibility helps SEO too.
